Description:
Are You Ready for a Lifestyle Change?
Welcome to Cashmore Drive at the 13th Beach Golf Links Estate. This gated community offers privacy, integrity in peaceful surrounds. Build your new home nestled amongst existing high quality homes. This block offers you land size of 838sqm approx. and adjoining common property right next to the 4th Hole of the acclaimed Faldo Creek Course.
This location is a gateway to the Bellarine Peninsula, Barwon Heads village and ocean beach with Geelong and Melbourne an easy drive. Make the change and you won’t look back.

Description:
Build A Surf Coast Lifestyle Here - 60 acres - 24.3 ha (approx.)
Families seeking a convenient Surf Coast Rural lifestyle will be well rewarded with this exceptional property that comes with an approved planning permit to build.
Highlighted by a brilliant location close to public transport and only minutes to the new Warralily Shopping Centre, ten minutes from Geelong and the seaside township of Barwon Heads with its quaint shops, cafes, restaurants and golf courses plus Torquay and the Surf Coast, and just over sixty minutes from Melbourne via the Ring Road.
The property consists of 60 acres of gently undulating land divided into 3 paddocks with dam, excellent solar powered fencing, small hay shed, wooden cattle yards and with town water connected it could be used for mixed farming, cattle or horses.
Insights: 602 Lake Road, Connewarre VIC 3227 was last sold in 2016.

Description:
"Corrin" - 60 Acres - Tree and Sea Change - 8 Minutes to Barwon Heads
“Corrin” provides a rare opportunity in convenient Connewarre complete with a Fasham home sitting on 25 ha – 60 acres approx. Complete with large living, dining and kitchen area flanked by a parents’ retreat with en suite and walk in robe, and a children’s wing with two bedrooms and shared bathroom. The spacious living/dining room centres on a wood fire with study nook to the rear.
Upon entry via Shaws Lane, this sprawling property is close to Lake Connewarre and its surrounding wetlands and comes complete with 2 car carport, separate double garage including studio, several paddocks with central laneway, shearing shed, cattle yards and separate machinery/hayshed, electric fencing and town water connected. The property is ideal for sheep and or cattle! Mature trees and established shelterbelts provide wind protection and seclusion.
Just over an hour from Melbourne, 20 minutes from Geelong and 10 minutes to Torquay. If you’re in search of a serene sea/tree change for your family or a home for restful weekend sojourns, this outstanding property provides it all!
Insights: 580 Lake Road, Connewarre VIC 3227 was last sold in 2017.

Description:
Golf Course Lifestyle
Situated at Barwon Heads Resort 13th Beach Golf Course Estate, this upper level, two bedroom, one bathroom, self contained apartment comes fully furnished with reverse cycle heating and cooling and private balcony. The apartment enjoys Beach Course outlook over the 15th hole while the further surrounding 36 hole golf course designed by Tony Cashmore in conjunction with Nick Faldo provides a spectacular outlook. Within walking distance to 13th Beach, patrolled beaches and only minutes drive to the heart of the Barwon Heads cafes, local restaurants and shopping to complete your weekend/holiday or permanent living lifestyle.
Insights: 3 other 2 bedroom unit in Connewarre have recently been sold.

Description:
Quality Home, Fantastic Location, Resort Style Living
Unique opportunity to become part of one of the Bellarines best kept secrets. Home of the Oates Victorian Golf Open, 36 Second Drive 13th Beach offers a stunning home perfect for permanent living or resort style holidays.
The home services a blend of external rustic timber, floor to ceilings windows, full length timber decks and large tiles all coming together in a Mediterranean theme. The beautifully landscaped garden leads you to the front door and upon entering, full view of the outside paved and stepped alfresco courtyard.
The North wing offers two generous sized bedrooms both with ensuites for family and guests. The open plan lounge, kitchen and dining flow from the courtyard to the privacy of views adjoining the second Hole of the Beach Course. It features polished concrete floor, high ceiling, island bench and well appointed kitchen. Polished timber floors also feature in the reading room separate study and main bedroom with its ensuite and garden views. Large garage with storage shelves and separate laundry complete the essentials.
For the golfer, 2 championship courses or for those just wanting the privacy and safety a gated community offers, this is worth your inspection. 5 minutes to Barwon Heads, 20 minutes to Geelong and 5 minutes by golf cart to 13th Beach and Bass Straight.
Ready to make your move? This will change the way you live.
Insights: 36 Second Drive, Connewarre VIC 3227 was last sold in 2016 and 4 other 3 bedroom house in Connewarre have recently been sold.

Description:
LAKESIDE RURAL LIFESTYLE WITH UNMATCHED VIEWS
A unique mix of coastal and rural living with a view to which very few are privileged, creates a unique opportunity on this 27.46 acre (11.11 ha) hobby farm. Perched on the banks of Lake Connewarre, views of the You Yangs and lights of Geelong set a striking backdrop to the still lake waters; all this is captured from a northerly aspect in almost every room of this sprawling rural homestead, just minutes from beautiful Barwon Heads.
The property would specifically suit retiring farmers wishing to downsize to smaller grazing land or equine lovers with 4 existing holding yards and 4 electric fenced paddocks of various sizes. A 4 bay shed is fully powered with hot water shower, workshop while an old bluestone shed offers storage or tack room.
The exquisitely built, well-proportioned home is both stylish and practical offering multiple living spaces, 4 bedrooms and a dedicated study. Built to maximize views, the solid brick home provides more than just a rural retreat; a country style wraparound verandah surrounds the home with internal walls of brick and cedar and solid timber cabinetry creating a stylish and timeless interior. Formal and casual living connect, centering around an enormous kitchen linking the oversized outdoor entertaining area, while sleeping quarters are separated for zoned family living. High quality appliances (halogen and gas cooking) plus dual fridge cavity and walk in pantry provide a well-appointed kitchen sized for farm style catering, while outdoors a built in BBQ sits within a paved and covered outdoor room for entertaining.
Beautiful floor to ceiling timber bay windows capture views across the north while also allowing natural light to fill the entire home along the south. The master suite consumes one end of the home with great proportions right through to the ensuite. His and hers walk in robes, spa bath and separate toilet offer privacy and luxury. The dedicated study (close to the master) is fitted wall to wall with storage and desk space for home businesses while 3 additional large bedrooms offer well fitted robes (1 also with desk joinery). In this section, the family bathroom and laundry provide large sized wet areas with immense benches and cupboards creating good usable work space in the laundry.
Climate control within the home is well considered. A brick open fire place sits amongst the formal living and dining areas while wood heater and refrigerated air conditioning exist in the central zone. Reverse cycle split systems are also fitted to north facing bedrooms for ultimate comfort in extreme weather conditions.
A double garage attached to the home has been converted to a huge living space complete with floor to ceiling windows for a rumpus room with a view! This space can easily revert back to vehicle storage simply by removing carpet. Town water is connected to the property with 4 large tanks for additional supply and a clear water septic system running off to the surrounding grounds.
Placed only 10 minutes to some of the region's best beaches and Geelong's rapidly developing growth corridor, this property provides the perfect lifestyle retreat with space for your hobby and breathtaking views to top it off!
- Lake front home offers beautiful northerly views
- Great for retired farmers or equine lovers - 4 holding yards & 4 large paddocks
- Expansive proportions to multiple living zones all with views
- 4 large bedrooms - master with exquisite ensuite
- Dedicated study perfect for home business
- Separate shedding includes workshop with plumbing
Land: 27.5 Acres approx.
Insights: 20 Staceys Road, Connewarre VIC 3227 was last sold in 2016 and 3 other 4 bedroom house in Connewarre have recently been sold.

Description:
Have the lifestyle you deserve
Exceptional allotment of 1019m2 approx. perfect for a large family home in one of the best estates in Victoria. Take advantage of the idyllic lifestyle this prestigious address has to offer, within minutes to the 13th Beach Golf Links Fairways & Clubhouse, the sand & surf of 13th beach and all that Barwon Heads has to offer; primary school, cafes, restaurants & a variety of specialty shops.
- 1019m2 approx. allotment
- Adjacent to the 6th Green
- A frontage of 28.96m
- Close proximity to 13th beach, Barwon Heads beach, cafes, restaurants and a wide variety of specialty shops
- Only a short 30 minute drive to Geelong's CBD
- One of the best estates in Victoria
Land: 1019 sq m. approx

Description:
The Best Of All Worlds!
This superbly located 4 bedroom family homestead offers premier rural living on the edge of the city and within a stone's throw of world famous beaches. Boasting approx 2 acres and extensive shedding, this property is only 3 minutes to Bremlea/Bancoora Beach & a 10 min drive to the coastal townships of Torquay and Barwon Heads while only 15mins from the Geelong CBD.
Walking through the central foyer area of this solid brick home you will enter into the open plan kitchen/ living area that no doubt is the heart of this home. The solid timber kitchen with electric cooking & dish washer comprises ample bench space and plenty of storage as well as a huge walk in pantry. Adjoining this living area is a formal dining area and formal lounge that are both carpeted. On one side of the living area is the luxurious master retreat starting with the spacious master bedroom featuring bay windows which continues on to the extensive walk in robe and large ensuite/bathroom that also includes a relaxing spa bath to unwind in after a long day. Down the other end of the home is the kid's wing comprising 3 bedrooms all with robes, a second bathroom and ending with the great kid's rumpus room featuring bay windows, games cupboard and practical timber dados on the walls so kids can be kids.
Stepping outside this home only gets better with a north facing timber decked alfresco area that overlooks the in ground solar heated pool which is surrounded by timber decking, tiled edging and beautifully landscaped gardens, providing a tranquil setting that's perfect to relax & entertain. Additional features of this home, which is on town water, includes plenty of storage, split system heating & cooling, front & back undercover veranda that runs the length of the home, adjoining double garage with remote and 3 water tanks with 30,000 litres storage capacity. All your boys' toys can be securely housed in the 9x 16m shed with concrete floor & power. Privacy is ensured with mature trees on the boundary & the bonus of sweeping views over the neighbouring paddocks. Within easy reach of the newly completed ring road entrance, access to Geelong's Northern Suburbs & Melbourne is a breeze. This truly is the best of all worlds on offer & sure to impress.
Insights: 95 Bluestone School Road, Connewarre VIC 3227 was last sold in 2019 and 3 other 4 bedroom house in Connewarre have recently been sold.

Description:
Space and Coastal Calm in Connewarre
Within a stones throw of Victoria's best beaches and close to the sought-after townships of Barwon Heads and Torquay, this peaceful lifestyle property is the perfect coastal-rural fusion. Boasting approx. 2.15 acres, a comfortable 4-bedroom family home with study and extensive shedding, this is the ideal retreat for a family in search of self-sufficiency and a lifestyle free of urban distractions.
The solid brick home has a spacious floor plan that wraps a central north facing alfresco area providing a natural indoor-outdoor flow to living, dining and entertaining. All rooms showcase calming rural views and are presented with contemporary flair.
Open plan living incorporates the kitchen and meals spaces. Granite benches and the walk-in pantry are impressive, and the wood burner is a cozy focal point. Glass sliders open out to the alfresco, flooding the space with warm northern light. Formal lounge/dining is graced with restful views over the treed grounds. This is a relaxing zone for adult enjoyment.
There is also a roomy home office with separate access, ideal for a home run business.
Rejuvenate in the peaceful master bedroom at the facade, with walk-in robe and en suite. Three further queen-sized bedrooms with robes sit in a wing of their own beyond the living zones. The central shower room is bright and tidy. The separate toilet and storage-laden laundry are family essentials. Two split systems assist comfort.
'The Good Life' is achievable with space for production supported by water tanks. The septic tank worm farm provides rich soil supplements to ensure a bumper crop!
The feature dam and casual gardens provide relaxing nooks for contemplation. The two bay machinery shed offers excellent storage for a tradie and space for a man cave. There is also a single garage and carport. This quiet property will bring out your inner tranquility! Inspect ASAP!
Insights: 40 Randles Road, Connewarre VIC 3227 was last sold in 2015 and 3 other 4 bedroom house in Connewarre have recently been sold.

Description:
Coast 'n' Country Lifestyle
This fantastic property offers 7.5 acres with Barwon Heads and 13th beach only minutes away, 15 minutes to Geelong, and easy access to Torquay or Melbourne by freeway. The main residence captures the rural outlook with a picturesque northern setting from the living and alfresco area overlooking the landscaped grounds. Boasting 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, master with WIR and en-suite recently renovated, plus two living areas. This house truly is comfortable in every aspect and ready for you to call home with the welcoming polished floorboards and fireplace. A bungalow close to the main residence is also perfect for the guests or as a hobby studio. Further features include a 6 x 12 meter workshop, another 9 x 4 meter garage, 40ft shipping container secure and water-tight, fully operational shearing shed with holding yard and races, a 14,000 litre rain water tank plus mains water is supplied. Electric fencing, 6 paddocks all with well-constructed shelters, mains water and quality pasture will accommodate the horse enthusiast or hobby farmer. With Lake Connewarre only 1km down the road take advantage of the jetty facilities for canoeing and fishing. A rare opportunity in a great location away from the hustle and bustle, with plenty of open space for kids to play. The Mt Duneed Primary School bus also stops right on the corner. You need to walk around to truly appreciate the lifestyle this property has to offer. Call today to inspect!

Description:
Versatile Home Offering Country Lifestyle
What a great lifestyle opportunity to enjoy everything living in the country offers, surrounded by farms and creatures without the upkeep of paddocks and sheds.
This very comfortable 3 bedroom brick veneer home has stood the test of time.
It offers formal lounge with wood combustion heater and RCAC.
The kitchen meals area has been renovated.
Polished timber floors feature throughout.
The rear sheltered deck is north facing with a rural outlook over the established garden.
The land area is 739sqm and offers the opportunity to extend the existing house (STCA). If you are looking to move to the country and be 15 minutes to Geelong and 10 minutes to Barwon Heads, look no further.
Peter Molloy : 0417 558 205

Description:
Country, City, Coast? This One Has It All!
Looking for a country lifestyle? Like the convenience of being 5 minutes to the coast and 15 minutes from Geelong CBD? Then this property is a must see.
Privately situated on approximately 3.75 acres, zoned Low Density Residential, with town water connected; the land is a manageable size and perfect for anyone looking for space.
The family home comprises an open plan kitchen/dining/family room, all facing north with views over the large front lawns and paddocks, 3 bedrooms, two with BIRs, large master with ens/WIR. Family kitchen has an electric cooktop and oven, large pantry and dishwasher. The formal lounge with wood heater, plus there is a large covered area at the rear of the house perfect as a games room or kids retreat
Outdoors are stunning, drought tolerant gardens, two rainwater tanks, storage shed, double garage with workshop (9m x 6m)), double carport, extra shedding, 4 large paddocks.
This is a great property for entertaining, with an undercover pergola adjoining the decked above ground pool and spa.
A short walk to the Connewarre reserve, tennis courts and horse riding club, and the school bus stop right out the front; the location is perfect for families, with so many activities available. Call for inspection now.

Description:
When is a Shed NOT a Shed?
When it is a fully serviced 3 bedroom home of course!! It may be constructed from colourbond externally but DO NOT let that fool youthis is a spin on contemporary living that you would never have dreamed possible if you could not see it for yourself; and you should do exactly that to be able to properly absorb the full extent of the clever planning that has made this so much more than just a 'temporary' home.
With the intention of living here during the construction of a grand family residence elsewhere on the 2.64 acre allotment, the current owners spared no expense nor overlooked any trivial detail in the building of what has turned out to be an amazingly architectural building in its own right. North facing highlight windows, above average specification, completely sealed internal plaster walls and ceilings plus 3 separate reverse cycle heating/cooling units all contribute to an internal climate that is welcoming at all times of the year. Combine these with funky design elements such as polished concrete floors, modern galley kitchen (complete with stainless steel appliances and rustic redgum island bench) and the vastness of the open plan living areas, (finished with feature walls and bulkheads), and you have a ready-made home that could serve you beautifully whilst you build your dream, or be, in itself, just your kind of home.
You neednt worry about any of the nasty surprises that have a habit of cropping up on these types of properties either. The certificate of Occupancy has been issued, the all-weather driveway has been constructed for longevity, the site is completely powered by a 2 phase system that services both the shed and a further home site closer to the entrance of the block, a top-of-the-range septic treatment plant with subterranean irrigation has been installed and has ample capacity to service two homes, a large number of trees have been planted, water tanks are in place plus town water is available, secure vehicle storage is sorted and you could even apply for street access to Breamlea Road if you so desired. This would make the extra short trip to the beach even shorter!! Not to mention allowing direct access to the shed if it were ever to become the base for your home business or studio.
If you like the privacy offered by the court environment though, you are still ideally located just minutes from both Torquay and Barwon Heads with Belmont and Geelong within a short ten minute drive.
Honestly, there is an opportunity here that is rare in every sense. The truly hard (and incredibly expensive) work has all been done to a very high standard meaning that the possibilities for both immediate and future use are almost limitless. Regardless of your plans, if a rural home by the sea is your idea of heavenmake an inspection of this property a priority.
Insights: 4 other 3 bedroom house in CONNEWARRE have recently been sold.

Description:
'Clovelly' - A place full of charm
A home full of charm with a warm welcoming feel from the moment you turn in the driveway. A perfect hobby farm of approximately 5.8 acres with landscaped gardens surrounding the main residence, full of character & providing huge potential for you to make your mark. 2 spacious living areas, kitchen & dining room, 3 bedrooms, one with an open fire place & the other 2 with a shared ensuite. A fully self contained unit offers an income if you choose to rent it out or perfect for family and friends to stay. Ample shedding & fenced paddocks. If your'e looking for a lifestyle change to a hobby farm, just 7 mins drive from Barwon Heads & 15 mins to Torquay then this is for you.

Description:
RURAL LIVING AT ITS BEST
Looking for a country lifestyle, with the convenience of being 5 minutes to the coast and 15 minutes from Geelong CBD, then look no further.
Privately situated on approximately 3.75 acres, zoned Low Density Residential, the land is a manageable size and perfect for a family wanting to get out of town, have horses, motorbikes, even tradies who need extra space. The school bus stops right out the front and there is town water connected.
The 20 y.0 BV home comprises an open plan kitchen/dining/family room with a reverse cycle AC . The kitchen has an electric cooktop and oven, large pantry and dishwasher and has a pleasant outlook to the front lawn area and paddocks. The formal lounge has a wood heater, plus there is a large covered area at the rear of the house perfect as a games room. There are 3 bedrooms, two with BIRs, master with ens/WIR.
Outdoors are stunning, drought tolerant gardens, two rainwater tanks, storage shed, DG with workshop (9m x 6m)), double carport, extra shedding, 4 large paddocks. This is a great property for entertaining, with an undercover pergola adjoining the decked above ground pool and spa. The pool is salt chlorinated and has solar heating.
A short walk to the Connewarre reserve, tennis courts and horse riding club, the location is perfect for families, with so many activities available.

Description:
A Touch Of Paradise/Nothing But Class
Properties of this class do not come along every day. 3 acres of residence nestled in the peaceful and charming estate of Connewarre. Comprising 5 massive bedrooms all with built-in robes and master with elegant ensuite. Gourmet kitchen, huge gas stove, ample bench, cupboard, and pantry space which overlooks stunning living and dining area. Luxurious lounge complete with wood fire and formal dining area. Huge rumpus room complete with pool table area and bar. Stylish 2nd bathroom, spacious laundry, 3rd shower and toilet. The outdoor living this property provides is totally special. Elaborate timber decking surrounds the home and full veranda keeps the property cool all year round. Massive entertaining area ideal for alfresco dining, BBQ, under cover spa complete with timber decking and pizza oven which provides space for the whole family. Features 10 French double doors, solar hot water, quality fittings and amazing natural light. Double garage, garden shed and low maintenance gardens. Just minutes to beaches and easy access to Geelong and ring road.

Coastal / Rural Lifestyle Property (28 Acres)
Ideally set between Barwon Heads and Geelong and only minutes to the 13th Beach Golf Club and the Ocean.
Character home with three bedrooms, formal and casual living areas, family and en suite bathrooms and plenty of Old World Charm.
Stand alone one bedroom open plan unit, 9 paddocks, town water and a stunning garden with large shade trees, a great veggie patch and private sun traps.
Looking for your own piece of paradise which offers a most successful blending of rural and coastal living? Inspect to fully appreciate this lifestyle property.

Description:
Tyintin
Escape to a less complicated life just 15min from Geelong, 5 minutes to famous 13th Beach and 10 mins to Barwon Heads. An excellent farm of 20 acres with significant infrastructure in a well treed, park-like setting , suitable for a wide range of agricultural or equine pursuits. Mt Duneed school bus is at the corner or Barwon Heads Primary and Kinder is just down the road. For secondary schools, the bus is on Barwon Heads Rd. This solid, passive solar, 3 bedroom + study family home is ready & waiting for your creative flair. With flowing spaces & three living areas, the home will accommodate the growing family. Three good sized bedrooms, main with ensuite featuring a spa to soak in after a hard day's work.
This home has a 440 litre solar hot water service that has off-peak boost for times of overcast weather. Two 22,000 litre water tanks supply the home or you can just use the town supply.
Other features include a double car garage with internal access and remote door and new floor coverings throughout the home.
This property has several sheds, a feature being the large shed that is 36mx9m with power, telephone and concrete floor. Second smaller shed also has power, phone and concrete floor. Property has 10 paddocks serviced with town water and accessed with a central laneway. Cattle yards and undercover sheep yards with small shearing shed also feature. This charming farming/rural environment is waiting for you, enquire today.
Insights: 40 Belchers Lane, CONNEWARRE VIC 3227 was last sold in 2012 and 3 other 4 bedroom house in CONNEWARRE have recently been sold.
